description:
To be honest, all the Starbucks  
coffees tasted not much different. 
I'm here in SF training for 2 weeks, coffee is my way to survive in the class. 
The reason why I'm putting up 5 stars with my strict standard is because of this nice gentleman Dylan!

Dylan is always smiling when he sees people.
His patience not only does he listened,
there was one time I came to Starbucks in the morning forgetting the name of my coffee.
He listened and directed me to the right product!

Dylan not only remembered my name but also remember that I have lactose intolerance with milk and can only take almond milk. 
That's very sweet of him!

I'm sure everyone has the ability to do what Dylan does in service but no one would be like Dylan who is willing to go far and beyond to reach more than the satisfaction. 

Thank you Dylan, you deserved my 5 Stars!
author: David C.

description:
Thanks for kicking this location back into shape. Prompt friendly and clean store. 


Dear Starbucks, 
I promise I am not a transient. 
As I get off BART, often times I need to use the restroom (it's a long way from Union City on the train)
As always, when needed, I politely ask for the code for the restroom. 
This day, I was asked "was I a customer?" and did I make a purchase yet. I held my tongue, and ordered. When I asked if she could hold my order so I could use the restroom, I got the . 
Now, I am here all by my lonesome, and prefer not to bring my food in  toilet area unless necessary. Hence the restroom break before the food. 
I understand the transient issue in the CITY. I do. I work here, and live close enough. 
There has to be another way, no? 

Well... I guess history taught them a le
author: John R.

description:
This Starbucks is located near the north east corner of Drumm and California not far from the Metro Embarcadero station and the eastern end of the California street cable car turn.

I was waiting at the eastern end of the California cable car and some Muni works were doing something at the tracks and the cable car was there for a while.  I asked the Muni worker nearby if this was going to be a while and he said they were just cleaning something having to do with the track and that it would be maybe 10 minutes.  I saw this small window as an opportunity to go in and get a mug.

I've been looking for the You Are Here series of mugs but it seems those are all gone these days.  The "Been There" collections seems to have taken over as the new mug series and although they are the same size and shape, the design is all different.  My niece wanted one and I swear walking around San Fran it's almost impossible to go 3 blocks without seeing one but for some reason no stores seemed to have the mugs except finally this small one on Drumm.  That being said I was able to buy one and get back to the cable car turn and hop on.
author: Lambert P.

description:
Truly unfortunate how this beautiful Embarcadero area is occupied by hostile homeless and panhandlers... they were there in front of Starbucks as well shaming clients that didn't give money to them.  
Took 20 minutes to have an order taken. Dirty tables and chairs. Dirty creamer/ sugar/ trash station. Only half and half available.  Out of order restroom... out of egg whites... this is breakfast hours... this place has so much potential since it is located in the busiest area... Disappointed as a long time patron to find such a mediocre place
author: Sunny S.

description:
PROS: Spacious and plenty of seating. Good central location in a typically busy part of the city. Close to BART. 

CONS: Each time I come here, it's kind of messy (like "no one sweeps the floors" kind of messy). In a busy part of the city. Nothing really extravagant. Service is pretty poor, but not the worst. 

Honestly I'd just recommend this Starbucks if you're looking for a place to do some work without the hassle of fighting for seats. I usually make this a meeting spot when I have to work with people since I know we'll usually be able to secure seats and of course not have to worry about wifi since all Starbucks offer it anyway.
author: Danielle M.

description: The morning shift employee Janie is really rude,yelling at the customers and tell them what to do,really bad customer service.
author: Glenmorangie S.

description:
Standard Starbucks.

The service depends on who you get. A few in here are kinda cranky.

Not my first stop for coffee in the city.
author: John J.

description:
This is the closest Starbucks we have to our hotel, and have been coming here every morning for breakfast. So far, I can say that the staff isn't very friendly or fast. They also mess up orders AND give you wrong ones on purpose, simply not to go through the struggle of making coffee - happened to my husband this morning.

I've been a customer of Starbucks for over 10 years now, and visited plenty of Starbucks to say that this one isn't that great!
author: G F.

description:
I only come here for their breakfast sandwich and their venti iced water. I only drink and water not because I'm cheap but I have a personal issue with people that drink coffee.

But that's not the reason why I gave them a one-star, because they no longer give up venti iced water because it's the summer and they will run out of cups if they gave up venti iced water.

So now I'm stuck with tall ice water for the whole summer because this Starbucks is too cheap to spend more on expense but it's okay for them to charge me $5 on a stupid breakfast sandwich.
author: Calvin Y.

description: I ordered a drink on the app. Quite a while later they hadn't started it and did not even have a ticket. I mentioned this and that I had paid for it and the man was less than friendly but started my drink. He delivered a drink to me that was not what I had ordered, and I left the store, late for a meeting, and without a refund.
author: Cara H.

description:
Worst!  I regret coming here.  There are some things that are out of anybody's control and that would be the homeless population and the frequent rowdy customers.  That being said, the employees are rude.  I placed an order via mobile app and waited in the store for 20 mins. The customers who came in after me all had their orders ready and I just stood there.  I went up and saw that my drink was ready but nobody had called my name out loud.  When I told the barista it was my drink she's holding on to...she pretended she didn't know what I was talking about.  I had also ordered a breakfast sandwich which everyone was clueless about.  Later the manager nonchalantly says they're out of the one I ordered.  I didn't get an apology or anything.  

Maybe I am extra harsh because I'm a former Starbucks barista but I've always asked people if they wanted a replacement as soon as I realize we were out of something and not wait for 20 mins.  Sorry.
author: Me V.

description:
I just went to pick up my mobile order at 8:30 pm and this location was CLOSED half an hour early, even though online and on the mobile app says it closes at 9pm on Sundays. The doors were locked and garbage bags were placed in front of the doors. I saw a cashier lady at the front, so I knocked, but she ignored me. 

Closing half an hour early is pretty ridiculous and so is being ignored by the staff. Luckily I called Starbucks customer service, and they gave me a refund. This Starbucks location = LAME.
author: Abby D.

description: Quick service, nice people. My sister got a free brownie bc guy heard her say she wanted one. Coffee is good, as always.
author: Anna L.

description: These guys are great. I mobile ordered when I visited but my order was always ready when I visited and the store was pretty clean. Reliable location *thumbs up*
author: Gabby G.

description: Needs to hire more people. Two mornings in a row took over 15 minutes to get drinks after ordered.
author: William L.

description: Good Starbucks, sometimes it would be very busy and there are no lines, so customers are not sure where to stand. Also if you order small cup of coffee don't charge it as LARGE.
author: Nihad V.

description: Location wasn't busy in comparison to most mornings and it took 16 minutes to get a drink out. When I first asked about it he said it was next. Then when I went up and asked again he said he never had it. He asked another barista to make it and then talked shit in Spanish how everyone was coming at him for their drinks...
author: Adriana R.

description: Great customer service . They know what I want every time I guess I've been coming to the same location for a few years
author: Rolando S.

description:
Conveniently located near my hotel and the perfect stop for a hot chocolate as the sun disappeared and the typical San Francisco chill rolled in at the end of the day.

No brainer - lots of whipped cream, spell my name right, and I'll pay for your overpriced hot chocolate.
author: Allie A.

description:
Unacceptable! I went in to to get coffee so I could use restroom. They said it was out of order. Then said they need toilet paper. I told them I have my own they said they can't open it until they get more toilet paper. 
What's up Starbucks!!! Never heard of napkins? The reason u are so popular is because we can depend on this as our comfort station. Bad experience.
author: Sandi M.

description: This place is terrible the staff is rude and there location has to be one of the dirtiest Starbucks I've ever been to there's also a lot of homeless people asking for change all the time I don't have anything against homeless I just this it's unprofessional to allow them to panhandle inside of the storefront I would rather walk a block away to Philz coffee
author: Amy G.

description:
One of the better Starbucks around!  I was in downtown San Francisco in the financial district for several meetings and went to this Starbucks.  The place is a bit larger than most Starbucks that I've been in.  Lots of tables, lot of open space, quick service, and clean.  The lines moved rather quickly and the basitas worked really hard! 

Cheers to the employees at this Starbucks!  Great job!
author: Marko C.

description: Please tell me why people who work at this location have the worst attitude problem? I work around the corner and come here pretty much every day. And it never fails. I was pretty specific in my 4.95 drink and barista could not make it right. I didn't want to say anything because I didn't want to get eyes rolled at me and back the people up on their drinks. Switching over to Peets. That was the last straw for me.
author: Racheal A.

description: This Starbucks location is great. Not too busy, very friendly staff, and a very welcoming atmosphere.
author: Joe A.

description:
Super large. Super busy Starbucks for the FiDi. Possibly because you get the hotel crowd coming here? Maybe because this is on a path from BART to the Embarcadero Centers ... either way, I love Starbucks, but I would pass on this location. 

Drumm St just epitomizes the juxtaposition of class here in SF. You have hoards of homeless people asking for change while multi millionaires from tech, consulting, and finance all skeet on by. 

Even with that being said, this Starbucks get's a bump from 2-3 stars because of their great prompt service. They are used to the volume, so they get you in and out with your order with the swiftness. The staff here has to be on their game and they usually are (come on everybody we all make mistakes sometimes).

Check it out if you're in the area ... although I'll be honest there is a nearby Philz (where the old Noah's used to be) if you have time to sit around for your coffee to drip haha.
author: Joseph L.

description: Would give zero stars if I could. After a long day walking through this beautiful city, my family and I (10 of us in total.) came into this location for a nice hot drink. I simply asked one of the managers (with the long black ponytail) if I could have the passcode to the bathroom. Have you know, I was wearing a tie dye pullover, tie dye shoes, and box braids. She then profiled me, and rudely replied "you need to buy something before you can go in." Personally I prefer not to bring food/beverages into the facilities, nor leave them out for someone to taint. As I proceeded to sit with my family, she walked by giving me a dirty look. If you are going to get a job in customer service, I would suggest following your companies ethics. As you can probably guess, I did not, and will never spend my money here.
author: Aridyse W.

description:
Was in the area on a late Saturday morning and in need some coffee, we stopped by this Starbucks on Drumm St. This is a good-sized store, spacious with many tables for you to enjoy your coffee and food.  Loved the huge wall art of the world that highlights the coffee regions of the world where coffee beans are sourced. Approaching the counter, there was only one person in line. The wait was minimal, order was placed and was quickly filled.

Being in the FiDi and across from the Hyatt, I could see this Starbucks being busy during the weekdays. But on a Saturday, this was a nice stop for some coffee.
author: Al L.

description: Yet another shady and unfriendly staff Starbucks. And let's be honest, Starbucks deserved more than one Dollar sign. They have a lot of space here, but poorly designed, bathroom is disgusting and out of biz at all times.
author: Ramin A.

description: This is the closest starbucks around my work area.  I love starbucks mocha frap.  But they always mess up my order.  Other than that the place is nice and clean.
author: Crystal T.

description:
What can I say? It's a Starbucks in downtown San Francisco. Super busy, hustle and bustle atmosphere all around you but the baristas and cashiers work quickly.

I tried the new "s'mores tart" not so good... I'm a big s'mores fan and this tastes nothing like a s'more.

Breakfast sandwiches are served really hot, which is nice. 

SUPER COOL charging power mats at most of the tables to charge phones! This is so neat!
author: Melissa U.

description: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency recently, and although there was no Starbucks inside the hotel, I had the next best thing. The Starbucks on Drumm is literally right outside. Theoretically, you could jaywalk straight across to Starbucks, but I walked a few feet to the corner. In my 2-night stay, I visited this Starbucks twice. Technically I went three times, but the first time there was a line with 19 people, so I left and came back a little while later (I didn't want to be late to my conference). Great location!
author: Lorianne L.

description:
Early Saturday evening, staying at the Hyatt Regency Embarcadero, and we wanted some good coffee.  I knew there was a Coffee Bean right in Embarcadero 4, but geez, it closes at 4pm on Saturday!  Fortunately, right directly across from the Hyatt on Drumm is this Starbucks, and it's open till 10pm - perfect!

Good-sized interior with ample seating - could see myself staying here for a good long break if the time was right.  Being too late for caffeine, my wife wanted their Caramel Apple Spice drink, but it wasn't on the wall menu.  No problem they told me, they serve it all year, they just ran out of menu space!  They made it and it was perfect - yum.  Like a liquid Cinnabun.

Good place to keep in mind if you are at the Embarcadero area; it may be open when other nearby coffee places are not.
author: David F.

description:
This Starbucks is located on Drumm near the Embarcadero BART station and the Hyatt hotel. 

During rush hour this place is filled with Financial District folks and tourists, and the occasional crazy person that cuts the line straight to the bathroom. Maybe that's why you have to ask for the code in case you decide to use it.

Plenty of seating, and nice wall decor highlighting all the Starbucks coffee bean origins.
author: Sebastian F.

description: I would give a minus minus.  All I wanted was some shaken tea hibiscus refresher.  What did I get?  Horrible attitude from some chubby barista. I didn't say a word to her. Just kindly asked for a refund and went to Peet's.l will never spend a dime at that or any other Starbucks.
author: Casandra B.

description: We ordered an iced green tea latte and our barista didn't bother to shake it. He handed us our cup that was pale white milk with chunks of green tea powder stuck to the edges. We had to ask him to take it back and do it again. No apologies, just pure indifference.
author: Hendrick S.

description: These folks really stepped it up. I wasn't impressed in the beginning. But since I've been coming here regularly, they've changed my tune. I come in now & before I get to the register, they already have my order ready for me. This makes me happy, & they're really nice & friendly in here.
author: Paul C.

description:
The Starbucks across from the Hyatt Regency San Francisco (the one at 5 Embarcadero Center) is at a great location. The store itself is large and spacious. The drinks we got on different days were yummy and made correctly, except for one time--which is nice! The front door is not easy to maneuver if you are disabled. Luckily there were nice people around, most of the time, who would hold the door for me. 

It's the customer service that was horrible. When I asked questions, I got very short monotone answers. When one of the coffee drinks was made incorrectly, they corrected it but there was no apology, no helpful reply, nothing was said at all.  When you place your order, the cashier would clearly rather be doing anything else but helping customers.  The baristas were even less enthusiastic, if that's possible.   Not a single employee smiled, or said thank you, or said much of anything.  These people need some training. 

The drinks and the store get 4 stars, but the customer service gets 0!
author: Beatrix D.

description: The employees are good, service is good...what's the problem?  The pungent smell of urine that wafts in from the front door. The front door is filthy and needs more diligent cleaning. The sidewalk outside, while not necessarily Starbucks responsibility, is filthy. I get that the homeless issue at 5:30 am is sensitive, but in situations like this, you have to be immaculate once your customers get inside. Otherwise, it feels like a seamless transition from the filthy outside to the inside.
author: Janet H.

description: Staff is very unfriendly. I had my own Starbucks mix because the coffee is too strong at night so I like it watered down but she wouldn't let me get hot water even after showing her the Starbuck instant mix, unless I was paying for something else. But she did let the person in front of me get cold water. She said it's because too many "incidents" with the hot water which did not make any sense and seemed arbitrary and rude since I was about to order a sandwich. Luckily the guy behind me said I'll order something and get hot water for you. But the whole thing seemed unnecessary.
author: Steven S.

description:
This is a good sized Starbucks, there is a lot of room for people to sit. The baristas were friendly.

There is a code you need to get from the barista and you must purchase something before being able to use the restroom.

They have a good selection of mugs and tumblers and other items just like in other Starbucks. They also have a couple of different mugs with a SF design that you can only get in San Francisco.
author: Ale G.

description: Open until 9, plenty seats and friendly staff, free wifi and outlets. I mean what else I could complain about. May discard Starbucks sometimes but I still trusted in most cases.
author: Donna Z.

description:
A perfectly average Starbucks located in FiDi (they do call the Financial District that in San Francisco right? Or is that a New York City only thing?).  The area around the Starbucks was actually quite dead at 10:30AM on a Sunday morning so keep that in mind if you're looking for a hip and happening Starbucks.

This Starbucks was decently full though that morning.  Service and drink was just fine.  I was mostly surprised at how dead the surrounding area was.
author: Danielle C.

description: Two stars because the guy who takes my order is really nice, I come to this location often. I've been going to this starbucks since I started working in the city about 2 years ago. Most of the staff is friendly, but on several occasions recently I've been getting bad customer service from some staff members. For example, this morning I ordered a white mocha a donut, my drink was ready and i waited about 10 to 15 minutes for my freakin donut they usually bring the pastry or donut to front right away if it doesn't need to be heated.  I asked the blonde/brownish  hair girl and she didn't bother to check on it she just said he's bringing it soon and i told her I've been waiting awhile and she could care less.  So i just went up to food window and asked the guy and it was sitting at the counter in a bag. He had an attitude as well. I hope the manager is reading this, this is unacceptable and he has done this with my orders in the past. I've let this go on many occasions and next time it happens I won't.  I can say the battery street location is way better.
author: Sharrol S.

description: It's the people behind the counter that make or break the experience. Today, Wednesday the 8th I had a horrible experience. The lady behind the counter, took way too long, to serve me my coffee and pastries. She was more attentive to the customer before me. She told her barista how to "correctly "make every drink. The barista has been there a long time. I know this because I see him there frequently. Long story short. Marking this place off. Bye bye.
author: Johny M.

description:
I like that they don't call me out for my fake name when they write my name on my cup. What, I don't look like a Joe? I know its an unexciting alias but if I swap now, I'll probably forget while I'm standing there waiting for my drink.  Then it will be like,  Juan. JUAN! GRANDE SKINNY VANILLA LATTE FOR JUAN... to which I would go, "oh yeah, that's me..."and then sheepishly shuffle over to the counter. 

Anyhow, I will sometimes grab my morning coffee here and I like that the space is pretty big (largest Starbucks in the area I think) so I'm not feeling as crowded even though there's always a line before work. I see complaints about speed of the line in other reviews but they must have the A team for morning shifts because the line moves quick enough for me and I've never had to wait an inordinate amount of time for my drink.  As for the actual coffee, its typical Starbucks, generally alright with cream and sugar. If you like your coffee black then the coffee can taste be a bit burnt but maybe that's a Starbucks thing with how they roast their beans.
author: Huy V.

description: Not a bad place to get your work done if you're chillin by the Embarcadero. Only a block or two from the ferry building. Coffee was good.
author: Zach B.

description: The guys closed bathroom 40 min before official closing time after I bought my tea and advised me to seek bathroom outside
author: Dmytro L.

description: If I could give zero stars I would. This was absolutely by far the worst Starbucks I have ever experienced. Not only did they get our drink wrong initially they made us feel bad about it which is something that a customer should never experience. The barista taking our order was totally incompetent and did not understand the drink I wanted (I ordered an iced americano). I even heard the employees very unprofessionally talk to each other how messy and awful the experience was but none of them wanted to take the initiative to improve it. If I were managing this store every single one of those employees would be gone.
author: Jordan P.

description:
This is a review for my visit on April 3, 2016 at 7 PM. Despite some other kind workers that took my order and payment, the manager of the store was not accommodating and uncourteous: 

- around 8:15 PM, he went around the store to sweep and mop, interrupting every customer by making them stand and vacate their tables.
- although the store was open until 9 PM, the manager closed the restroom and would not let customers use it after 8:45 PM. 

A paying Starbucks client, I'm disappointed that a consistent and high level of service are not delivered at this location. I'm especially disappointed by the manager of this location, who will not accommodate customers personal needs and interrupts the time they try to enjoy at Starbucks.
author: Travel Swagger R.

description: Good service, nice clean restroom. Only one restroom, should have at least two, many times long lines for restroom.
author: Anisha S.

description: Great coffee here. They treat you right. They had cream and sugar compared to the other location where I had a terrible experience. Nice customer service. Good vibes.
author: Samuel A.

description: Great service! They spelled my name right on the cup too!! Nice quiet ambiance and was able to charge my phone quickly too.
author: Hope P.

description:
This is the best Starbucks Coffee shops in Financial District. Staff members are friendly, professional and courteous. They take and complete customers' orders with efficiency. Most importantly, service is prompt.

Free Wi-Fi available here so you can come in with your iPod touch, iPad, iPhone or laptop and surf the internet while enjoying a light snack with a cup of coffee.

EDIT FROM 03/10/2015
- Friendly staff members
- Fast, efficient services
- Clean, spacious facility
author: Bennett W.

description:
Your standard Starbucks. I came in a couple of times for a triple shot iced latte with whole milk.

The drink was strong, cold, and delicious both times! And provided the caffeine that my neurons needed to keep firing during a long day of training!

This Starbucks is conveniently located across the street from the Hyatt Regency Crystal City - so if you are staying at this hotel - convenient and quick place fort caffeine!
author: Neal E.

description: This location is terrible because of all the crazy people that hang around the area but the people who work here are still so cheerful and friendly no matter what. Their manager is wonderful and so helpful. I accidently did an online order to another location and she gave me my order here at no extra charge. That's amazing customer service! I called Starbucks to let them know what a great crew they have at the Drumm Street location and to notify them that the app confuses the locations.
author: Sofia B.

description: I have been coming to this starbucks for over 6 months and recently the baristas have been extremely rude and have no sense of customer service. I will be going out of my way to find somewhere else to get coffee and frankly am thinking about discontinue all my purchases at Starbucks and switch to Petes.
author: Kelann S.

description: Lots of space and great location but the staff can be rude. It says they close at 9 but they kick you out pretty rudely 15 mins before (this happened to me once out of the two times I've been here). At the end of the day, staff can be pretty curt.
author: J F.

description:
Does Starbucks really need another review?  Yes!  This one, across the street from the Hyatt Embarcadero, deserves a shout out for good service on September 15.

We had 30 minutes or so to kill while our room was being cleaned and wanted to avoid pricey drinks inside the hotel. Starbucks was the answer as I can always expect a certain standard -- and I had a gift card in my wallet.

All I wanted was a simple grande lemonade iced tea.  But they were out of lemonade.  The barista said he would substitute with mango pineapple (or was it mango papaya?). I was dubious, but thirsty.  It was surprisingly tasty.  When the barista saw I had finished and was lingering at the table he brought me a second one on the house.  Didn't get his name, but appreciate his friendly service.

I imagine on a weekday this place is bustling.  Not very busy on a Saturday. It is a bit more airy than some Starbucks.  The old red brick wall on one side is a San Francisco touch as was the one oddly dressed gentleman who was talking to himself. I thought perhaps he was rehearsing lines for a play ... but don't think so.
author: Elaine P.

description:
So unhappy with my experience at this Starbucks. My cousins and I came here before heading back to Bart, we had a very productive day in SF. We were in line for over 15 minutes and there were only 4 people in front of us, ridiculous. Then we waited 20 minutes for our drinks, and people who ordered after us started getting their drinks. We finally got 2 of our drinks (there were 4 of us) and we asked for our other two, and then the barista said she forgot to add our cups to the line of drinks to be made. Seriously unacceptable. On top of that, the baristas were rude and did not apologize to us. We just asked for our refund and left. I have never had such a terrible experience at Starbucks, and I will never return to this location.

My advice to management: hire people who actually care about their job, and properly train your employees. The employees there were just terrible. I didn't get names, but one was a short asian guy, a white girl with blonde hair, and a taller white guy, with dark, shoulder length hair - who was the most arrogant of them all. 

If I could give this place negative stars. I really really would. 

Yelpers, there is a Starbucks on almost every corner of San Francisco, avoid this location!
author: Kirstie F.

description: Oh Starbucks. I said my name was Margaret  and it's not spelled KEVIN. Other than that, you make a mean venti skinny vanilla latte.
author: Margaret W.

description: This Starbucks is absolutely the worst in SF. The cashier didn't know the current promotion or how to ring it up. I went to order my second drink which was another staple "lemonade" ... They were out...changed my order to Strawberry Acai ... "OUT"... Why would you run out of a promotional item? It shows a lack of knowing your market ... Whose up in Seattle doing the market analyzing for Cali? We invest in too much time & money to not get the first class service. Then as I'm waiting at the bar ... Another SB employee from another store ... Came in to borrow some items for their store... Omg!
author: Khadeejah S.

description:
Typos! Ugh!!!

Her name is spelled Dulce I'm so embarrassed. :/ Now remember to ask for her and be nice she's the bestest Starbucks has to offer in customer service. =)
author: Michele C.

description: Seriously!  Your employee is preventing customers from using the restroom because she wants to clean it. There is a rope barricade preventing customers to use the restroom. Sorry but normal people can't time when they have to use the bathroom. You have to go when you have to go. Female employee needs customer service training.
author: Taylor M.

description: The worst Starbucks shop in the world! The employees and the manager in the shop treat people disrespectful and extremely rude. I was there once right after my friend give them a negative review on Yelp. I was a new customer to them and ordered two drinks on that day, however, I wasn't  treated respectfully at the end. One of the employees called Alex. He is the rudest staff I had ever met. Even you just get a seat and keep quiet, you won't get any respect from him! And the owner of the shop wasn't very professional, experienced, and knew how to solve the conflict between customers  and employees. If you are heading there, be prepared to get an unsatisfied experience.
author: Tianjiao J.

description:
Service is sub-par, and bathroom's out of order?

I ordered a drink, and it took for ever for the Barista to make my drink, he decided that I was apparently not worthy to get my drink in the order in which it was ordered.

They were out of a lot of bakery items on an Sunday morning, what's going on with that?
author: Kevin W.

description:
I love this place.
OF course the poverty level outside is daunting at times 
Kindness Kills Apathy
author: Tim G.

description: Just why is the barista just standing there for orders to come in and I ask for a cup of ice water, he wants me to stand in line to "ring it up"? It's free. What is there to ring up? The order line is hecka long as i was the first in a crowd. I just ordered a bunch of sandwiches and drinks and I have to order water?  Ugh. Terrible service from this guy.
author: Hazel S.

description:
I had a problem, but the manager quickly fixed it. This is what shows how much a 
Business values there customers. Nice job of making a wrong right !!!
author: Mark A.

description:
It's a Starbucks. Nothing too much more to say - not the largest or the smallest, not the cleanest or the dirtiest (may be considered a feat considering the SF transients who frequent the local shops for warmth - in fact there is a man in there with a laptop, don't ask me where he got that, using the free wifi all the time), and being that it's smack in the middle of FiDi it gets extremely busy during the normal morning coffee hours. This location is on my way to work, but I frequently open the door, see the loooong windy line and immediately turn around and walk back out.

I will say though, what pushes this location to a 3.5 maybe even closer to a 4 star is that the employees are always high energy, friendly and fun. That is always appreciated, especially on bleary eyed Monday mornings.
author: Jocelin L.

description:
So, I kind of love this Starbucks:

1) They're open so early and closed so late, perfect for all of my spur of the moment Sbux cravings!
2) Ridiculously close to work
3) Coolest barista who works there who immediately picked up on my name and now greets me personally everytime I go in
4) Speedy service, roomy interior
5) They always make my order the way I want it, and the one time they didn't, they remade my drink and gave me both drinks!
author: Melody L.

description:
Was there Sunday at 11am.  They were out of regular plain ole sugar.  Told me I could go to another starbucks to get some.   Well I could go to the walgreens too and buy my own.  

What's so complicated with one of the employees saying hey run across the street and buy a bag of sugar to get us by.   No it seemed like it was no ones job.  Just do without...?
author: Benji S.

description: Horrible customer service. Made the wrong drink. They want you to buy something first before they give you access to the bathroom. Yelling this policy across the room. They tell these directly to kids too. Way to be classy, Starbucks.
author: Jovy G.

description:
This place rocks because of the people!! AAAAAANNND it's waaaaaay better than the grumps who work at the Starbucks directly behind them. 
Carlos is AMAZEBALLZ!! I mean...he always is smiling and chopping it up with customers.  He knows what drink I like before I even order it and always makes suggestions on trying something new.
So the haters can kiss it--peace
author: Jenna P.

description:
Sigh... starbucks has really gone down hill in general.  The issues at this particular starbucks (the 1st 2 of which seem to affect most starbucks):

(1) The iced coffee is watered down (seems like about half the starbucks out there don't know how to create proper iced coffee).

(2) The internet is totally freaking unacceptably horrible.  I often have to tether to my mobile device to get reasonable connection latencies at starbucks.  Over wireless.  Part of the problem is that the provider (AT&T) backhauls the traffic through Texas.  So stupid.  Given the downfall of libraries in California, starbucks is often the only place in the evening to do work on my computer.  So it's pretty frustrating that their internet is totally useless.

(3) The bathroom was closed for 30+ minutes within an hour of closing for "cleaning".  But the cleaning bucket was just sitting there, not being used.  Why can't they do that kinda stuff after they close?  When I worked a retail customer service job we were not allowed to kick people out, we had to let them complete their shopping and they had up to 30 minutes after the "official" closing time.  Now-a-days it seems I'm always being shooed out of places before the bell has even rung.  Here a basic facility was not available for many minutes before closing, which I'm assuming (I may be wrong) is because they wanted to do that work *before* closing so that they could leave as early as possible.  It's possible that someone destroyed the bathroom and hence they were doing us all a favor.  But given the overall slip in retail customer service, as well as the ridiculous amount of time they spent not finishing the work despite no customers being here, I believe my assumption is correct.  Luckily I have a large bladder.  D!c7s.
author: Erik W.

description: I spilled my hot beverage at this location the other day, and the staff were quite helpful. They cleaned up my mess right away. An employee done with her shift got me a replacement beverage before leaving. Thanks!
author: Mark A.

description: First impression: I like how it's not so crowded (middle of the day). The decoration looks nice and there are 11 tables with 2-3 chairs each. The staff is great and personable.
author: Vanessa V.

description:
I witnessed a rather odd scene - a spraytanned man bearing an Italian mobster demeanor decided to toss over an unoffending water bottle display at the front counter, shouting "That's how it's done in the ghetto!" 
With as much mild patience as an adult collecting a tantruming child, the gentleman behind the counter escorted mobster man outside:
"This in not a ghetto"
"FORGET ABOUT IT!" 
Unfortunately, a woman standing in line received a knee scrap from the flying display, to which another worker quickly aided with a bandaid.
Excellent work keeping it together, guys :) You are an example to us all.
author: Alexandra S.

description: This Starbucks is unfortunate in that it has a very aggressive guy who plants himself on the sidewalk right outside their door.   At 7:30am, I'm just not in the mood.
author: Meg W.

description:
I have been coming to this Starbucks sporadically over the years and the service and product have been acceptable until now. On Friday, June 14, 2013, I went with a coworker to pick up our regular drinks. I ordered a Grande Iced Coffee and she ordered a Chai Latte. Here are some bullet points to summarize our experience:

- Cashier: Extremely slow with no sense of urgency.

- Barista (Carlos): Rude with no attention to detail, no common courtesy, very poor customer service.

- Product: Extremely poor quality.

- Summary: When my iced coffee arrived, there were coffee grounds all over the lid; I thought nothing of it until I poured half & half in my coffee. To my surprise, there was a layer of coffee grounds at the bottom of my cup (about an inch thick). I promptly tossed the lid and handed my cup to the Barista (Carlos), politely pointing out the coffee grounds and requested a new one. He looked at me like I was inconveniencing him, took my cup to the sink and rinsed it out, poured iced coffee in it (didn't even apologize), and handed it to me (water all over the cup, because he didn't even dry it off). My new iced coffee was so light, it looked like iced tea. I tried to be positive and just poured some half & half in, and took a sip - it tasted like water with cream in it (basically no coffee whatsoever). At this point, I had already been away from my office for over 20 minutes, so I wasn't about to ask for a third one and sit around and wait for it. Instead, I asked for a comment card (Carlos said they were out), and went back to work and threw out the iced coffee. On a side note, my coworker's Chai Latte was poorly made as well.

Overall, this experience was so negative that I have decided that I will no longer purchase coffee or any product of any kind at Starbucks until they make significant staffing improvements. There are so many hard-working, courteous people looking for jobs service and it seems as though the only ones that get them have absolutely no customer service skills whatsoever.
author: Holly A.

description:
How come no one told me this location is a gathering place for all of the FiDi's crazies?

It was great at first. The lines are not as long as other SOMA/FiDi Starbucks, lots of seating (even during the 8am rush hour), the staff is fast, efficient and friendly.

On my last visit, a lady walked in and tried to sell me a lottery ticket she found on the ground outside. 

This morning, a guy cuts to the front of the line and loudly demands a cup of hot water - which he received. He then digs into his Trader Joe's shopping bag, takes out a packet of instant coffee, and proceeds to makes his own coffee right there on the spot.

The best part was when he he emptied every single Starbucks creamer into his plastic thermos, and proceeded to throw the F bomb at anyone who stared at him.

I can't make this stuff up.

The staff saw what was going on but didn't really do anything. Maybe they get this kind of stuff so often that they've just stopped trying. I suppose I can't blame them.
author: Mariela D.

description:
SERVICE:
The barista assisting me was Benjamin. He has a great attitude and was very helpful. Justin too. Free wifi. Woot.  (1700)

ATMOSPHERE:
I like this Starbucks. Open, nice feel, not too crowded, but a lively bustle from the worker bees filing in to get their morning coffee or their midday lunch coffee. I usually find a seat near the outlet, but I think there's only one.  ...Amidst Embarcaderro side, so walkable to the Ferry building and Embarcaderro center ;)
author: Angela L.

description: Ambiance is lost in the area with the ever present homeless.  I never felt more guilty drinking a 5 dollar coffee in my life.  Minus 2 stars for the worst breakfast sandwich ever.
author: Doug B.

description: Updating my review here. Recently they hired more hot women baristas! The guy staff are friendly. If there's a long line, dont' worry about it, it moves fast with these guys. The only drawback is the location. Occupy people has ruined this starbucks and surrounding area.
author: Jeff H.

description: Lots of seating!  Hard to find in the financial district!!  Service is a bit slow, they always seem short handed.  But a good pick if you want a table to sit and enjoy your coffee.
author: Josh G.

description: Service is always slow (even with no line) and today they made the wrong drink. Did I get an apology? NOPE! I won't be back.
author: Nancy L.

description: 9:30 AM Sunday. Short line. Good service. Disgusting service/prep table and NO SUGAR!
author: Bryan W.

description: This is one of my favorite locations in the city to relax and have my all time usual, Caramel Macchiato.
author: Terry S.

description:
3.0 Stars

Starbucks. They're everywhere.  I do remember feeling that in the past decade when I would literally see a Starbucks on every corner.

It was Saturday morning.  My sister and I were waiting to zipline in Justin Herman Plaza near by and this place was relatively close to the Embarcadero.

The outside environment wasn't completely the best. I counted at least two bums soliciting for spare change outside of this Starbucks.

Once inside, I had a good experience.  This Starbucks wasn't super big.  There were approximately 14 tables, a couch, and a lounging chair.

There wasn't much of a line so I managed to get my order and drink pretty fast.  I ordered a Tazo Sweetened Black Shaken Iced Tea Lemonade.  You can also have it made with Green Tea or Passion Tea instead.

I totally recommend getting the Grande (16 oz) or Venti (24 oz) size because this drink comes with a lot of ice.  The Tall (12 oz) barely has much in it and you'll be making those infamous *slurp slurp* noises through your straw sooner than you think.

Quick tip: You need a code to use the restroom here. You'll probably have to purchase something in order to use it.
author: Jason H.

description: My go to Starbeezucks only because they make my drinks right everytime! Fast and friendly service (employees make sure you leave with a smile) and have plenty of seating to hang out and do your thing. Lines can get a tad bit long but if you go around the corner on California, there's another Starbucks there!
author: Anna P.

description: The MOST GHETTO sbux in FIDI. It's like the Tenderloin threw up on this block. I lovingly refer to it as "skid row." Just experienced a homeless revolution inside this Sbux. Walking out of my way to go to the sbux at Gateway Plaza from now on. FYI: the baristas have a different definition of "no foam" than I do.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
This Starbucks staff has the coolest fleet of retro one-speed bicycles of any Starbucks staff I've encountered. Every time I coffee here and see these dudes & their bikes parked beside the counter I'm reminded of my bike messenger days SF years back.  

This staff is also one of the most customer-friendly I've experienced in SF, the polar opposite of the Starbucks Spear St Coffee Nazis I reviewed below.

Side note:  Beautiful people may follow you in here.
author: Jack H.

description: 7:15 am. Ordered a tall half decaf/ half regular coffee only to learn that they're out of decaf. Really? Isn't the point that you have coffee ready to go? Off to Peets. No issues there.
author: Jess C.

description:
OK, so I am inlove with this Jasmine Green Tea-Lime cooler from Peet's Coffee & Tea. However, I made a terrible mistake today and decided to go to Starbucks and try their version of the drink (green tea and lemonade). 

The Starbucks version was so gross that I took 2 sips and thew the rest away! Never ever again! 

Plus Starbucks coffee makes me sleepy. 

Oh so disappointed.
author: Lenee F.

description:
I didn't think Id really write a review for a Starbucks, but I kind of have a love-hate relationship with this store.

They are pretty friendly and very consistant with their drink quality.  Although this morning I ended up waiting at least 8 minutes for my drink (Double tall, soy, no whip, white mocha) to be made during the morning rush, when the standard should only be about 5 minutes for the wait from cash register to coffee bar.

The one thing that slightly bothers me about this place is one particular barista doesn't refer to me as 'sir' at all, but calls everyone else "ma'am" or "sir."  Instead he refers to me as "bro."  Just because I am younger doesn't mean I'm your "bro"

"What can I get for you ma'am, what can I get started for you sir?"

then he gets to me:

"Yo, whats up bro, what can I get you bro?  He'll ring you up here bro."

It isn't the first time, its EVERYTIME I come here, he calls me "bro," which is defintely a pet peeve of mine.  I hate it when people call me "bro," I'm not your bro.

The other thing that bothered me was, being a former Sbux Barista, they write names on the cups for a reason.  It's to personally recognize a customer as well as to make sure that people's drinks don't get confused, especially when its crowded.  They write the names down on the cups but never call out the names.

Actually this morning an annoyed customer said "can you please call out the names?"  Why bother to write the names and then just ignore them and let the customers figure out whos venti, two splenda, extra foamy, non-fat cap is?
author: Kameron K.

description:
I have had great experiences, and horrible ones. Well, only a couple that kind of creeped me out. 

The first or second time I went, I was with a friend. I was three months pregnant (and emotiional) at the time. It was a bad experience. Super crowded, and I happened to have the same name as the barista. This was pointed out by another barista, and the other girl with my name was super rude. She made my drink horribly and it was chunky with ice. All the tables were covered with trash and I am not talking one table...ALL of them. It was really disgusting. I had nowhere to sit inside, so I cleaned a table myself and sat down. I was so upset at their service that I refused to go back for months. I even went and complained to their general manager,

My next visit went much better. Not so crowded, and the staff this day was much friendlier. They actually made my drink properly. The store was clean, and no one acted rude or hated their job. I will make sure to stop by on slow days.
author: Tiffany P.

description: It's all been said before, so I have nothing to add ... except this ... any barista who spells my name correctly on the cup has earned 5 stars for her employer ... Good job !
author: Stephen W.

description:
Every Starbucks is the same bland, boring, sterile yuppie infested, "I'm in a rush, get my latte quick" type place.

Awful Coffee, lousy rude service, terrible sandwiches, overpriced everything.

I avoid it always unless I get a free gift card.
author: Ferdinand B.

description:
Let's say you move to a big city from a very small town, okay?

Then, let's say you find a Starbucks right next to your work. (Hallelujah, THIS is why you moved to the City!)

Next, a guy at Starbucks strikes up a convo and asks you out (even though he's a broker, ie: red flag holder).

Things don't work out because he's a jerk and you aren't; you have morals and he doesn't.

But, you're in luck. There's good news!

1. You aren't stuck dating a jerk.
2. a) You can easily find a new Starbucks, because there are 30 of them in a 1/4 mile radius.  
     b) You can take this to the next level, like I did:  Instead of becoming a regular at any one Starbucks, I play the field.  

That's right, I make the rounds between different coffee places, Baby, and I like it a latte.
author: Janney B.

description:
Reason 183: Why Starbucks Gets My Business


SCENE I:

Me: (Storming ahead of the line, trembling and weepy having just fallen on the Embarcadero Bart escalator, 8 months pregnant with a bleeding knee and hands and a ripped black cowl neck cashmere sweater dress.)  Can I have a band aid and use the restroom, I will purchase something as soon as I clean myself up I promise? 

Starbucks Barista: (inundated with customers during morning rush hour but stunned at the site before her) Oh my gosh, wait one moment (rushing to get a manager to assist regular injured pregnant customer)

Starbucks Manager: Rosie isn't it?  Come back here with me.  What happened?  Are you alright?  Here's a band aid, here's some alcohol wipes, sit down.  Can I call someone to come get you?  Let me get you something, do you want your usual?

Me: Um okay...

Starbucks Manager: (to Barista) Can you get me a Grande Nonfat Latte, Nonfat, Extra Hot with No Foam and a touch of Whip!  

Me: Here's my ATM...

Starbucks Manager: I think you could use a Latte on the house today

Me: (All cleaned up and put back together)  Thank you so much for everything...

Starbucks Manager: No don't worry about it, I just hope your day gets better.



SCENE II:

Me: (First day back at work, returning from a 4.75 month Maternity Leave) Hi, can I have a...

Starbucks Cashier: Wow Rosie, you look great!  You want the usual?

Me: Sure, Thank you!  You remember my usual?

Starbucks Cashier: Of course!  (To Barista) Can you get me a Grande Nonfat Extra Hot Latte with No Foam and a dab of Whip!  Thanks!

Me: Here's my Atm...

Starbucks Cashier: Nope, today its on the house.  Welcome back to work!



SCENE III:
Me: (First day back working in the city, after being gone for a few months working elsewhere in the East Bay...)  Hi, can I have a...

Starbucks Barista: Its already up on the bar here Rosie, you wanted the usual right?

Me: Right...a grande

Starbucks Barista: Nonfat, Extra Hot, No Foam with a bit of Whip!  Yeap its right here...

Me: Wow.  Thanks...
author: Rosie C.

description:
After leaving Seattle... seems like starbucks in SF SUCKS!

Monday morning and I need coffee wen to startbucks on Drumm street embarcadero (infront of Hyatt) 

I got a venti Drift! after a single sip, went back to the counter and ask if I can get a coffee.. 

TASTE like a WATER TEA! very bad! :-( made my Monday morning meeting sleepy!

Coffee is water down!!
author: Aemar E.

description:
Wow... "no room for cream" really means "no room." Filled to the brim. It's always nice to have more, but it's a challenge to get it to my desk. Don't test me before I have my caffeine.

Next time I'll be sure to say, "No room, but room for reason."

Big and spacious. Plenty of seats. Sometimes, hot chicks. What?
author: Keane L.

description: Sorry to say, this particular location sucks!! I don't come here often to this one.  Only when nothing else is open and desperately need of having something while waiting for Bart to open. When I do the drinks are not made hot more so Luke warm. Pastries are always old and dry. Occupy and Vagrants come in smelling and sit around you. Not sanitary!!  It's not the one there greatest.
author: Raquel L.

description:
4th of July, 7pm.  Why wouldnt you schedule more staff to close up on a night like this.  Directly across the street from the Hyatt?? My husband and I, my brother and his significant other decided to stop by on our way from the hyatt to the Embarcadero parking garage... we walk in and immediately, my brother says he cant wait in the LONG line because they had to make it home to catch fireworks. We say our good byes while waiitng in line.  the line for the bathroom was as long as the line for the drinks.  Lucky for them peeing doesnt take as long as ordering your drink. 

The only reason they are getting a 3 star rating is because I work for starbucks myself and I know what its like to be inundated with customers close to closing time and with not enough partners on the floor. with that said, it was pretty bad.  Messy spills all over the place, which were at this point dry and sticky because they had been sitting so long, I noticed that the person was emptying out the pastry case while i was still in line.. .(Oh Oh Oh . . . Dont dump that I was looking for something sweet to snack on... oh too late) and the line was to the door.  

to top it off, i ordered a tea and i pay the 0.40 cents extra to get that extra tea bag and I didnt get it.  When i go to the front to ask them to give it to me, he did, but it seems like noone wanted to be there (honestly I dont blame them, but if you are grumpy, i am grumpy) 

the person on bar did offer a bit of a smile, and he was very accomodating making sure that my caramel white mocha was made the way I wanted it.  

I hope you all have a better day tomorrow!! :P
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Convenient location.
Plenty tables.
Friendly staff.

Only had the pastries here so far. Haven't tried the coffee yet.

Not really feelin' the people outside constantly asking for money though. I mean, I don't mind giving it, but it makes the location feel less safe somehow. But it rounds off at 4 stars for being open on a late Saturday afternoon when most of the places around the area are closed/closing (Massimo, Noah's, Les Croissants).
author: Elaine H.

description:
You're probably not going to be in the Financial District at 5 o'clock in the morning on a Saturday. But if you are, you're probably going to want coffee. You can get it at this Starbucks, even though the other coffee shops are closed.

When I asked the barrista why they were open so early on a Saturday, she nearly fell to pieces. She didn't know, and she didn't want to talk about why she was there. Clearly a sore subject for her.

This is a rather large location, and the chairs looked comfortable. Starbucks is typically my fourth choice for coffee, but you could do far worse than this one.
author: Timothy O.

description: Let me start off by saying I am not a coffee drinker, lol. However, I do love SB's hot chocolate & teas! Just because I don't drink coffee, don't treat me like a second class citizen! When the barista giggles and makes fun of my apple cider order, its a little inappropriate. You definitely won't see me back at this Starbucks.
author: Deana D.

description:
So I walk in here, order a tall coffee and the dude ringing me up asks how my day is going.

"Totally crappy", I say.

He gives me a sympathetic look,  hands me my coffee and says "Well I hope this makes you feel better" and didn't charge me for my drink.

Now THAT is awesome.  The staff is so friendly here and pretty good lookin too.  Yay for Starbucks!
author: Jennifer S.

description: If Lacretia is representative of the general service of this location, five stars are warranted. (Otherwise, I know nothing else about this location, as a first-time visitor.)  This young woman was professionally friendly and willingly responsive to  questions.  She even assisted us with wending our way through our laptops to obtain Internet access.  A review, I felt, was in order.
author: Dorsey M.

description: I wouldn't say I'm a huge Starbucks fan since the coffee is neither wonderful nor bad to me. I guess it's just consistent. However this location actually feels like a coffee house, with some decent furniture and interesting cross section of patrons filling it out. I went for one of those super sized (whatever their lingo is) sized chai teas and it was pretty decent and served surprisingly fast. What was most interesting was the people watching. Artsy types, wedding parties, tourists and businessmen. Interesting crossroads of coffee break and witnessing.
author: Kim N.

description: For a high traffic location, they are remarkably slow, and they have a tendency to overheat the milk, making your latte undrinkable for at least 20 minutes.  UGH.
author: Nikki c.

description:
This really is a great Starbucks.  They are so fast!!!  And there is seating that you can witness all kinds of humanity utilizing.  And regarding Starbucks in general:
C'mon people someone is shopping here.  As in, all of America! (and most likely you..yeah, you there with the striped shirt)  Ok, I guess I wish I went some where less corporate but there is a reason that they are successful and it is that that I personally admire.  We just have to keep these big businesses in the lime light with ethical issues.  They do literally control the ebb and flow of the U.S.A.  Let's force them to be good stewards.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Solid Starbucks.

No line.

Venti sugar free vanilla soy misto.

Starubcks card.

I'm out.

What more can you ask? What more do you need?
author: Kelly G.

description:
I used to come to this Starbucks SO many times during my lunch break when I worked at the Embarcadero. A nice beverage, a good book, and I'm all set. The staff is very friendly and the manager really makes sure they provide good customer service.

I remember one afternoon, someone - who I assumed was the manager - called every staff member one by one and discussed their work ethic and overall effectiveness of customer service. He pretty much gave them scenarios that may occur during the typical work day and asked how they would handle that particular situation, and then offered feedback. Not that I was eavesdropping, but they were sitting very close to me and I couldn't help myself but hear what they were talking about.

I'm sure they chose to do this right in front of the customers so that people would know that they take customer service seriously. And...well...it worked. =) Customer service at this Starbucks is great and the cashiers strike up conversations with customers quite often, which is always nice and friendly on their part.

I'm not going to review their beverages and food. Come on, it's Starbucks, they're everywhere! This review is strictly based on customer service. =)
author: Narina A.

description:
I know it seems silly to review a Starbucks, since they can't possibly deviate wildly from one to the next, but I have a special affinity for this particular location. Starbucks initially took over the world by exporting their comfy coffee shop atmosphere to even the most banal locales, but few of them actually retain that comfy feel like the Drumm St. one does. They actually have overstuffed couches and easy chairs, so there are almost always people in there reading, talking, or glued to their laptops. It's also a great neutral ground to meet someone you don't know (like potential roommates) for the first time. Kind of like a real coffee shop. 

It's nicely located on one of my favorite wierd little blocks of the city, both around the corner from a bunch of office buildings and right across from the Hyatt and cable cars. So I think they do just as much tourist business as corporate slave business. 

Plus, if you know me, you know I'm a huge sucker for exposed brick.
author: Megan W.

description: It takes a lot for a Starbucks to actually stand out from a cavelcade of other Starbucks, but the Drumm Street Starbucks is literally the best Starbucks I have been too.  It starts with the staff, which is as good as any Mom and Pop store you will come across.  And because the staff is so good, the drinks come out better.  Never watered down, never too sweet or too bland.  Even when the lines are at the end of the store, the drinks are still made quickly and effeciently.  They also have a lot of chairs, which is something I love in coffee shops because I tend to roost and enjoy my caffeine.  I still have my favorite mom and pop coffee shops, but I have yet to find one in the Financial district in which I can sit down and not feel like I am sitting in a closet filled with people.  A great staff that takes what Starbucks can offer to the max combined with actual elbow room makes this the BEST Starbucks in the area.
author: Patrick F.

description:
Um, the coffee is fine.  I go to Starbucks for the sweet, foofy concoctions that all my serious coffee drinking friends--you know, the ones who go on and on about their French press and like to critique the bean-roasting endeavors of other coffeehouses--make fun of me for ordering.  This Starbucks delivers.  I'm pleasantly, predictably sweetened, foofed, and caffeinated when I walk out the door, so hey, four stars.

The fifth star is for the super-hot boys I see behind the counter in the early morning.  Seriously, they're like gay-porno-hot.  I often wonder if they have whipped-cream fights a'la Zoolander during their down time.
author: Miss N.

description: I go to Starbucks daily. This is the first time I've been to this one, and they were the FIRST to offer me my Iced Green Tea in a new "Trenta" cup! When I asked if it was new, they said: "Sort of, we've had it for a month now!" I was floored that my local Sbux hadn't offered it to me earlier! I always get a Venti, but with the new 31oz Trenta, I can get my tea fix through lunch time! Thanks for the suggestion Drumm Street Starbucks!
author: Ryan B.

description:
After a long day of biking along the streets of San Francisco, what better place to find your spectators than a glorious and oversized Starbuck's?

Yes -- that's right -- I did not bike ride.  I just watched.  And then I sat down in Starbuck's on my lazy butt.  A big, fat Starbuck's for my big, fat lazy butt.

I didn't actually order anything.

But the location was huge and there two super-awesome, marginally insane homeless women out front yelling at us.

How much more SF can you get, right?
author: Joel F.

description: Marcus has great customer services!!!! Always in a great mood.
author: J J.

description: When I worked at Ann Taylor, I use to always stop by this Starbucks location during my 10 or on my lunch break. I loved getting the greek yogurt and honey with granola (if I was only on a 10) or the mozzarella, tomato and spinach panini (if I was on my lunch). The baristas here are really nice and I appreciate their friendliness. However, they take FOREVER AND A DAY to make a the simplest of drinks, such as my green tea with soy milk. I would watch my time fly by for my break because of how long they took. It irked me because even if they were completely NOT busy, it still took them forever. You could be the only customer and they would still not be fast enough on your order.
author: Surge C.

description:
*Note: I work here, and I'm rating us against other starbucks, not against coffee shops in general.

This Starbucks recently changed Management and I think it's shaping up Nicely.  I think we have a fun staff, and a great group of regular customers.

I give us 4 stars, because we aren't perfect (yet) but we're working on it.

Stop by for a coffee tasting, any coffee you're interested: in a french press.
author: Luke G.

description: Terrible customer service - elitist, snobby, worst barista stereotype you'll ever see. Vaguely racist, in fact. I suggest you boycott this one - there are plenty of good starbucks in town.
author: Seva L.

description:
This would be a five star review but I had to take one star off because the place was a bit understaffed.  It was the morning of the Bay to Breakers and there were only three employees.  This is, of course, the one Sunday morning that they could take in mind boggling revenue limited only by how fast they punch the register and pass out the goods.  Instead the line went all the way back to the door and I saw a constant parade of folks open the door, take one look at the line and move on.  It was like clockwork.  Every 10 seconds the door would open and a potential customer or group of customers would start to enter, notice the line and immediately exit.  The occasional die hard would join the line and so an equilibrium maintained the length of the line exactly equal to the distance from the counter to the door.
Speaking of die hards, when I arrived at 6:40AM the line was exactly at the door.  I squeezed in and began to examine the line to confirm that my running partner had not yet arrived.  As I got half way through the line my cell rang and I answered: "May I take your order please?"
Even stressed by the throng of caffeine seekers, the employees were friendly and professional.  One took orders and wrote on the cups, one collected the moola and the third employee operated the caffeineOmatic machine.  As I place two napkins and two cups of coffee on a table my friend walked in right on cue.  The most amazing part of this experience was the music that was playing the whole time.  One of the aforementioned excellent employees had put on some lovely gospel music sung by Mahalia Jackson.  It reminded me that Bay to Breakers or not, it's still Sunday morning.  It also reminded me of my grandmother.  Thank you.
author: Ron R.

description:
Rating a Starbucks is up there with rating a McDonalds. However, this location deserves a review. A good review.

There's a nice energy about this one. The people-watching is also on a more interesting level than your average Starbucks. This location doesn't seem quite as...what's the word I'm looking for?............amateur.  Not that I'm a coffee snob (far from it in fact) but there is a classier vibe about this location, without any pretentiousness (come on, its Starbucks after all).  

Oh yeah, and they also make hot breakfast sandwiches in the morning. You don't find that at most locations in the financial district.
author: L. Renee D.

description: This is the worse Starbuck.  When you order a capucinno, they give your 75% milk foam.  You have to go back to tell them to spoon out the foam and put more coffee in it.   First they will take everyone's order before you.   They are so unorganize.  It happend more then once.  They are fast but not for the ones who they over looked.
author: Mar H.

description: i really love this starbucks!!! everyone is friendly especially maury/mari not sure how she spells it...i walk threw the door there, i dnt have to tell her what i want..she know and already has it dne by the time i pay..THATS AWESOME!!!!!
author: Cristina I.
